results.title: Bhowani Junction
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Pandro S. Berman and George Cukor
results.brief_description: In what is considered by many fans to be her best performance, Ava Gardner stars as the half-caste heroine Victoria Jones, a woman forced to make some painful life decisions in post Colonial India. Her relationship with three men; Colonel Savage (Stewart Granger) a British military man in charge of protecting trains crossing Bhowani Junction, fellow Anglo-Indian Patrick Taylor (Bill Travers), and Sikh communist Peter Illing who befriends Victoria after she kills a potential rapist in self defence - challenging her to assess where her loyalties and ethnicity lie. Adapted from the novel by John Masters.

results.title: Beyond therapy
results.creator_credit: New World Pictures, Roger Berlind, Sandcastle 5, Steven Haft and Robert Altman
results.brief_description: Prudence (Julie Hagerty) is a conservative and slightly mixed-up young woman who thinks Bruce (Jeff Goldblum) is crazy. Bruce is crazy about Prudence, despite the fact that he is bisexual. Their therapists are no better off. Prudence’s therapist (Tom Conti) is more interested in scoring with his female patients than in treating their problems. Bruce’s therapist is as flighty as they come. Throw in Bruce’s jealous lover Bob (Christopher Guest), and his overly protective mother, and the scene is set for madness and mayhem. Adapted from his Broadway play by screenwriter Christopher Durang.

results.title: Beyond Rangoon
results.creator_credit: Castle Rock Entertainment, John Boorman, Barry Spikings and Eric Plestow
results.brief_description: Patricia Arquette stars as American doctor Laura Bowman who flees to Burma on a package tour with her sister, Andy (Frances McDormand), following a family tragedy. Rather than achieve the peace and solitude she is desperately searching for, she encounters problems when the clash between peaceful protest and a militant government take an ugly turn. Andy flees the country, but Laura finds herself alone after being separated from her tour group, and without an identity after her passport is stolen at a political rally. She is befriended by a former professor (Aung Ko) who attempts to help her reach the Thailand border, and an allegory is drawn between a young woman’s plight to reach freedom and that of a nation facing political unrest. On their journey they witness firsthand the political struggle encountered by a group of dissidents. Cast also includes Spalding Gray and Victor Slezak.

results.title: Betty Blue = 37.2 Le Matin
results.creator_credit: Claudie Ossard, Jean-Jacques Beineix, Constellation and Cargo Films
results.brief_description: A contemporary tale of ‘amour fou’ based on the novel by Phillipe Djian, “Betty blue” is the story of Zorg (Jean-Hugues Anglade) who at 31 has accepted a certain measure of resignation, and the beautiful, passionate nineteen year old Betty (Beatrice Dalle), who dramatically enters his life and proceeds to dismantle his complacency with her volatile, urgent nature. Betty and Zorg’s life together is dominated by Betty’s fearless embracing of whatever emotion or new circumstance presents itself. This propels them both into a series of events and encounters by turns comic and poignant. Betty’s restlessness and her ever-worsening mental illness finds a focus in Zorg. She decides he is a brilliant writer and she sets about despatching his diaries to potential publishers. In the face of disappointment, however, Betty’s increasingly extreme reactions begin to reveal an instinct for self-destruction that Zorg is helpless to subdue. French language with English subtitles.

results.title: Better than chocolate
results.creator_credit: Race Films, Telefilm Canada, British Columbia Film, Anne Wheeler and Sharon McGowan
results.brief_description: Maggie has flunked law school and is working for uptight Frances, who runs a gay bookshop in Vancouver. Kim is a van-dwelling artist. When they meet it is love at first sight. To avoid confrontation with her mother, Maggie makes up a success story and tells her that she’s living in a beautiful apartment ( she is - it’s just that she’s housesitting for a woman who runs Safer Sex With Latex workshops). Just at their relationship is blossoming Maggie learns that her mother and brother (who have no idea about her sexuality) are planning to come and stay with her. This confronting movie is about the problems young lesbians experience coming out and facing their parents (and society) and realizing that in the long run being a lesbian is not the worst problem one can have.

results.title: Better living through circuitry [DVD]
results.brief_description: Although directed by John Reiss,Better Living Through Circuitry’ is a collaborative documentary exploring the evolution of theRave’ counter-culture with particular focus on the American scene. It explores the technological and musical evolutions with artists, Kraftwerk,Genesis p. Orridge, Carl Cox, the Crystal Method and also more contemporary experimentalists like Scanner. The D>I>Y sampling techniques have recreated the means and understanding of musical perception. Very much a postmodern exploration,yet the psychedelic focus still somewhat reminiscent of thehippie’ revolution of the late 60’s. BLTC explores how raves and warehouse parties ascribe to letting go of inhibitions,social mores and prejudices of mainstream society. They exist as a communally creative release allowing individualism and the celebration of altered states. The film draws parallels with ancient tribal and ritualistic gatherings. Using flash photic light and patterned low wave pulse frequencies,the trance state generates a metabolic connection in the Beta Brain State. More than anything,Better Living Through Circuitry’ is an announcement to the world that tribal rituals and spirituality are alive and well in an age of technological dominance.

results.title: Betsy's wedding
results.creator_credit: Touchstone Pictures, Louis A. Stroller, Martin Bregman and Alan Alda
results.brief_description: Directed by Alan Alda, “Betsy’s wedding” is about a father (Alda) who must survive his daughter’s wedding, with all its fractious factions, complications, cost, deal making and emotional turmoil. An intermittently amusing work, with the highlight being Anthony La Paglia’s turn as a mobster’s nephew who falls for the bride’s policewoman sister. Cast also includes Joey Bishop, madeline Kahn, Molly Ringwald, Joe Pesci, Ally Sheedy.

results.title: Best in show
results.creator_credit: Castle Rock Entertainment, Karen Murphy and Christopher Guest
results.brief_description: Director Christopher Guest and cast members from his previous film ‘Waiting for Guffman’ reunite in this mockumentary following the exploits of five dogs and their handlers before the Mayflower Kennel Club Dog Show. Guest himself plays Harlan Pepper, a fly-fishing store owner and amateur ventriloquist, who decides to enter his beloved bloodhound Hubert in the prestigious competition. His competition includes “Winky”, a Norwich terrier, owned by neurotic couple Gerry and Cookie Fleck (Eugene Levy and Catherine O’Hara) and “Beatrice” a high-strung Wiemaraner owned by preppy couple Meg and Hamilton Swan (Parker Posey and Michael Hitchcock). Also making the trip to Philadelphia are Scott (John Michael Higgins) and Stefan (Michael McKean), life-partners from New York and their beloved Shih Tzu “Miss Agnes”, and trophy wife Sheri Ann Cabot (Jennifer Coolidge) and her friend and dog trainer, Christy Cummings (Jane Lynch) and their poodle, two time ‘Mayflower Best in Show’ winner, “Rhapsody in White”, also known as Butch. Cast also includes Fred Willard, Bob Balaban, Ed Begley Jr and Lewis Arquette.

results.title: Benny & Joon
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Susan Arnold, Donna Roth and Jerremiah Chechik
results.brief_description: Benny runs a car repair shop and also look after his mentally ill sister, Joon, who tends to create disturbances when left unattended. After Joon suffers a losing night of poker, Benny must also take in Sam, a friend’s cousin, who has his own share of erratic personality traits. Not surprisingly, Sam and Joon immediately hit it off. As they fall deeper in love, Benny must deal with new feelings of jealousy and of not being needed so much by his sister. Cast includes: Johnny Depp, Mary Stuart Masterson, Aidan Quinn, Julianne Moore and Oliver Platt.
